results.title: Operation and care of the Victor projector
results.brief_description: Explains by use of close-up photography the construction, threading, operation and care of the Victor 16 millimetre sound projector. Illustrates correct procedures for cleaning and lubricating the projector.

results.title: Operation and care of the Bell and Howell projector
results.brief_description: Close-ups show how to thread and operate the Bell and Howell 16 millimetre sound projector. Also shown is the correct method for setting up the equipment. Stresses the importance of proper maintenance and care. Bell and Howell Filmosound models 179 and 185 are used in the demonstration.

results.title: Operation Adaminaby
results.creator_credit: H Malcolm and Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric Authority
results.brief_description: Details the moving of the township of Adaminaby from its old site, soon to be flooded by the rising waters of Lake Eucumbene, to a new location six miles away. The building of the huge Adaminaby dam across the Eucumbene River to form Lake Eucumbene, the heart of the scheme, faced the Authority with the choice of either buying out the residents or moving their town. After consultation a new town was laid out and the houses moved, at times under unusually difficult conditions. Historic churches were demolished and reconstructed; a new shopping centre built; trees planted and a garden competition organised. Within two years the entire town was re-established, the diversion tunnel closed and the water began to rise over the old town.

results.title: Operating under pressure
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Films (Australia), Victorian Pipelines Commission and John Richardson
results.brief_description: Construction of the 108-mile pipeline conveying natural gas from Dutson to Dandenong, Victoria. Shows manufacture, welding, testing and laying pipes, discussing problems encountered, and the final turning on of gas.

results.title: Opera school
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: Shows how a young singer during three years at the opera school of the Royal Conservatory of Music, Toronto, prepares for an operatic career. The film follows the progress of Marie Burton (played by Marguerite Gignac) from the time she first appears for audition until she rises to a leading role in the annual opera festival. The enthusiastic dedication to music by the youghful aspirants is caught by the camera, in school and out. Excerpts from operas are heard throughout the film, and the final section presents part of a full-dress performance of Mozart’s “The Marriage of Figaro” in English.

results.title: Opera favourites with Placido Domingo and Kiri Te Kanawa
results.brief_description: Te Kanawa and Domingo are two names which rank amongst the most illustious in the world of opera. Both singers bring consummate skill and artistry to their individual performances, but together they form a partnership which is perfectly balanced, achieving a musical and dramatic rapport. All the exceptional musical and dramatic qualities Te Kanawa and Domingo command can be seen and heard in these magnificent performances. Selections are from; Die Fledermaus, The tales of Hoffmann, Agnes Baltsa, La faniciulladel West, Otello, Ernani, Manon Lescaut.

results.creator_credit: Barrie Nelson Productions and Barrie Nelson

results.title: Openly in the city
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description: Two different approaches to the problem of educating mentally handicapped children. The first is based on the premise that the children need guidance in personality development as well as basic educational skills, in order that they may gain an identity, and thus an idea of their place in society. The second approach involves perfecting certain skills through structured programs, in the belief that the individual will develop as he masters skills Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Opening speech: McLaren = Discours de bienvenue de Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: An animated film in which Norman McLaren is caught by his own film tricks. He attempts to welcome the audience but is frustrated by a reluctant microphone that has a will of its own. Originally made for the official opening of the Montreal Film Festival. (Awards: London) Contains both French and English dialogue.
